Amid the dispute China's central bank this week again lower the amount of cash reserves banks must hold in order to boost spending as NPR's Rob Schmitz reports
This is the fourth time that people's bank of China has cut China's reserve requirements this year it comes after Beijing pledged to invest billions of dollars in infrastructure projects as China's economy shows signs of cooling with investment growth at a record low
The move announced on the last day of China's weeklong national day holiday will inject more than a hundred billion dollars into China's banking system
Analysts say it shows China's government is worried about the impact of external shocks to its markets such as last week's speech by us vice president Mike Pence who accused China of trying to undermine President Trump ahead of next month congressional elections
